author: lzybkr
body:
Using the assembly name to hint at the source of the classes was
problematic in multiple ways.

This change stores the actual filename in an attribute on the assembly.

So for a given type, one can get the assembly this way:

[SomeType].Assembly.GetCustomAttributes() |
    ? { $_ -is [System.Management.Automation.DynamicClassImplementationAssemblyAttribute] } |
    % { $_.ScriptFile }

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is great, but the usage seems too complex to remember.  Can we use ETS to just add a ScriptFile property making it more discoverable?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT - I've only seen 1 request for this ability - from the author of ISESteroids - so ease of use doesn't seem too critical. I suppose we could use a `NoteProperty` on the assembly instance, but that is harder to access from C#.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @lzybkr we can wait for customer request before adding more.  Thanks
